item.title: Can knowledge of conscious level be applied to to conscious content?
item.description: There is a tendency in ‘consciousness science’, as well as in science more broadly, to approach content of consciousness and level of consciousness very separately. Bayne et al. (2016), while being critical of the definition of levels, note a relative lack of research into ‘global’ states of consciousness as opposed to local, phenomenological states. Empirical research into the latter tends to focus on neural correlates of consciousness (NCCs), the neuronal mechanisms necessary for a specific conscious percept (Overgaard and Overgaard, 2010).
